00018 /**
00019  * Creates RX packet type
00020  */
00021 Pkt::Pkt() {
00022         last_error=0;
00023         sz=0;
00024         buf=NULL;
00025         ei_x_new_with_version(&tbuf);
00026 }//
00027 
00028 Pkt::~Pkt() {
00029 
00030         if (NULL!=buf) {
00031                 free(buf);
00032                 buf=NULL;
00033         }
00034 
00035         ei_x_free(&tbuf);
00036 
00037 }//
00038 
00039 void
00040 Pkt::clean(void) {
00041 
00042         if (NULL!=buf) {
00043                 bzero((void *)buf, sz);
00044         }
00045 
00046         ei_x_free(&tbuf);
00047         ei_x_new_with_version(&tbuf);
00048 }
00049

00051 Pkt::getTxBuf(void) {
00052 
00053         return &tbuf;
00054 }//

00056 unsigned char *
00057 Pkt::getBuf(void) {
00058 
00059         return getBuf(Pkt::DSZ);
00060 }//
00061 
00062 unsigned char *
00063 Pkt::getBuf(int _size) {
00064 
00065         //allocate minimum size
00066         //for efficiency's sake
00067         if (NULL==buf) {
00068                 if (_size<Pkt::DSZ) {
00069                         buf = (char *) malloc(Pkt::DSZ);
00070                         sz = Pkt::DSZ;
00071                 } else {
00072                         buf = (char *) malloc(_size);
00073                         sz = _size;
00074                 }
00075                 bzero((void*) buf, sz);
00076                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO,"Pkt::getBuf: creating to size: %i", sz);
00077         }
00078 
00079         if (NULL==buf) {
00080                 sz = 0;
00081                 last_error = EEPAPI_MALLOC;
00082                 return NULL;
00083         }
00084 
00085         //requested size fits the
00086         //current size? else realloc
00087         unsigned char *tmp;
00088         if (_size>sz) {
00089                 DBGLOG(LOG_INFO,"Pkt::getBuf: reallocating to size: %i, current: %i", _size, sz);
00090                 tmp = (unsigned char *) realloc(buf, _size);
00091 
00092                 if (NULL!=tmp) {
00093                         sz = _size;
00094                         buf=(char *)tmp;
00095                         bzero((void *)(buf+sz), (_size-sz));
00096                 } else {
00097                         last_error = EEPAPI_REALLOC;
00098                 }
00099         }
00100 
00101         return (unsigned char *)buf;
00102 }//

00109 int
00110 Pkt::getLength(void) {
00111         return len;
00112 }

00122 PktHandler::PktHandler() {
00123         last_error=0;
00124         ifd = 0; //usually stdin
00125         ofd = 1; //usually stdout
00126 }//
00127 
00128 PktHandler::PktHandler(int _ifd, int _ofd) {
00129         last_error=0;
00130         ifd = _ifd;
00131         ofd = _ofd;
00132 }
00133 
00134 PktHandler::~PktHandler() {
00135 }//

00138 /**
00139  * Waits for 'len' bytes from
00140  * the input pipe
00141  *
00142  * @return >=0 len retrieved
00143  * @return <0  ERROR eg. EPIPE
00144  * @return 0   ERROR / EOF
00145  */
00146 int
00147 PktHandler::rx_exact(Pkt **p, int len) {
00148 
00149         unsigned char *buf;
00150         buf=(*p)->getBuf(len);
00151 
00152         int i, got=0;
00153 
00154         do {
00155                 if ((i = read(ifd, buf+got, len-got)) <= 0) {
00156                         return i;
00157                 }
00158                 got += i;
00159         } while (got<len);
00160 
00161         return len;
00162 }//
00163 
00164 /**
00165  * Waits for a complete packet
00166  *
00167  * @return 0 SUCCESS
00168  * @return 1 FAILURE
00169  */
00170 int
00171 PktHandler::rx(Pkt **p) {
00172 
00173         DBGLOG(LOG_INFO,"PktHandler::rx - start");
00174 
00175         //read length field first
00176         //int result=PktHandler::rx_exact(p, 2);
00177         int result=PktHandler::rx_exact(p, 4);
00178         if (result<=0) {
00179                 DBGLOG(LOG_ERR,"PktHandler::rx - ERROR reading length field in header");
00180                 last_error = EEPAPI_ERRNO; //check errno
00181                 return 1;
00182         }
00183 
00184 
00185         unsigned char (*buf)[] = (unsigned char (*)[])(*p)->getBuf();
00186 
00187         // length field on 2bytes format
00188         //int l = ((*buf)[0] << 8) | (*buf)[1];
00189 
00190         // length field on 4bytes format
00191         int l = ((*buf)[0] << 24) |  ((*buf)[1] << 16)  |  ((*buf)[2] << 8)  |  (*buf)[3];
00192 
00193 
00194         DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "PktHandler::rx - header len[%i]", l);
00195 
00196         // the packet length gave us
00197         // the information we needed
00198         // to extract the right count
00199         // of bytes from the pipe
00200         result = PktHandler::rx_exact(p, l);
00201         if (result<=0) {
00202                 last_error = EEPAPI_ERRNO;
00203                 return 1;
00204         }
00205 
00206         (*p)->setLength( result );
00207         DBGLOG(LOG_INFO,"PktHandler::rx - got [%i] bytes", result);
00208 
00209         return 0;
00210 }//
00211 
00212 
00213 /**
00214  * Transmits a packet
00215  *
00216  * @return 0 SUCCESS
00217  * @return 1 FAILURE
00218  */
00219 int
00220 PktHandler::tx(Pkt *p) {
00221 
00222         if (NULL==p) {
00223                 last_error=EEPAPI_NULL;
00224                 return 1;
00225         }
00226 
00227         ei_x_buff *buf = p->getTxBuf();
00228         if (NULL==buf) {
00229                 last_error=EEPAPI_MALLOC;
00230                 return 1;
00231         }
00232         unsigned char li;
00233 
00234         int result;
00235 
00236         //write packet length on 2bytes
00237         //=============================
00238         //li = (buf->index >> 8) & 0xff;
00239 
00240         //write packet length on 4bytes
00241         //=============================
00242         li = (buf->index >> 24) & 0xff;
00243 
00244         DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "PktHandler::tx: size byte 1: %i", (int)li);
00245         result = PktHandler::tx_exact((char *)&li, 1);
00246         if (result<=0) {
00247                 last_error = EEPAPI_ERRNO;
00248                 return 1;
00249         }
00250 
00251         li = (buf->index >> 16) & 0xff;
00252         DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "PktHandler::tx: size byte 2: %i", (int)li);
00253         result = PktHandler::tx_exact((char *)&li, 1);
00254         if (result<=0) {
00255                 last_error = EEPAPI_ERRNO;
00256                 return 1;
00257         }
00258 
00259         li = (buf->index >> 8) & 0xff;
00260         DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "PktHandler::tx: size byte 3: %i", (int)li);
00261         result = PktHandler::tx_exact((char *)&li, 1);
00262         if (result<=0) {
00263                 last_error = EEPAPI_ERRNO;
00264                 return 1;
00265         }
00266 
00267         li = (buf->index) & 0xff;
00268         DBGLOG(LOG_INFO, "PktHandler::tx: size byte 4: %i", (int)li);
00269         result = PktHandler::tx_exact((char *)&li, 1);
00270         if (result<=0) {
00271                 last_error = EEPAPI_ERRNO;
00272                 return 1;
00273         }
00274 
00275         // write packet body
00276         result = PktHandler::tx_exact(buf->buff, buf->index);
00277         if (result<=0) {
00278                 last_error = EEPAPI_ERRNO;
00279                 return 1;
00280         }
00281 
00282         return 0;
00283 }//
00284 
00285 int
00286 PktHandler::tx_exact(char *buf, int len) {
00287 
00288         int i, wrote = 0;
00289 
00290         do {
00291                 if ((i = write(ofd, buf+wrote, len-wrote)) <= 0)
00292                         return i;
00293                 wrote += i;
00294         } while (wrote<len);
00295 
00296         return len;
00297 }//
